instruction: You are given a question on high school computer science. You are also given 4 answer options (associated with "A", "B", "C", "D"), out of which only one is correct. You need to answer the question by selecting the correct option. You should only answer with the choice letter, not the whole answer.
input:
What is the role of the compiler in the process of developing executable software?
(A)Managing specification files created as part of the development process (B)Running and testing the executable created by the programmer (C)Tracking older versions of the software in case an error is found and the software needs to be reverted to an earlier form (D)Translating a program written in an abstract, high-level language into a program with the same behavior expressed in machine code
